checks.notes: Successfully navigated to Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation. Navigation path is clear and accessible through left sidebar. The Daily Wage Calculation section displays a table with three services: Salary proration, EOS leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction.

All three calculation basis options are present and functional: (1) Working days - dynamic calculation based on working days in month, (2) Calendar days - dynamic calculation based on actual calendar days (28-31), (3) Custom days - fixed configurable number. Dropdown shows all three options clearly labeled. Formula updates dynamically based on selection.

Salary component configuration is present showing 'Basic salary + allowances' across all services. Formula consistently displays '(Basic salary + allowances) / [calculation method]'. Current implementation shows this as a fixed configuration rather than a selectable dropdown, indicating company-wide standardization.

UI demonstrates clear awareness of month length variations through multiple mechanisms: (1) Calendar days option with dynamic formula handling 28-31 days, (2) Custom days option allowing fixed configuration (e.g., 30.45, 30, 22), (3) Working days option for dynamic working day calculation. The Calendar days option specifically handles month variations including leap years.

Successfully navigated to EOS configuration. Navigation flow: Settings > Payroll > Expand 'End of service eligibility' section > Click 'Configure' button. Opens comprehensive 'End of Service Eligibility' configuration dialog listing all available leave types.

EOS configuration displays salary component as 'Basic salary + allowances'. Field is shown as disabled (greyed out) with informational alert: 'Daily rate is configured in daily wage calculation setting'. This demonstrates the override behavior where payroll-level settings take precedence.

Calculation method configuration is visible in EOS dialog showing: Month calculation = 'Custom days' (disabled dropdown), Number of days = '22' (disabled field). Fields are disabled because configuration is controlled by central Daily Wage Calculation settings in Payroll. The main config shows 'EOS leave encashment: Basic salary + allowances / 22 days'.

EOS eligibility dialog displays comprehensive list of leave types with checkboxes for individual configuration. Observed leave types include: Sick, accruals, Vacation45 (checked and expanded), mister baker, Leave salary test for demo, Vacation 123456799, and many more. Users can select which paid leave types are eligible for encashment during end of service by checking/unchecking boxes. Expanded view shows calculation details.

Clear override indicators are present: (1) Blue alert banner at top stating 'Daily rate is configured in daily wage calculation setting' with 'View' button for navigation, (2) All calculation fields (Salary Component, Month calculation, Number of days) are visually disabled/greyed out, (3) 'How daily rate is calculated' section shows inherited configuration. This provides excellent transparency about configuration hierarchy.
Successfully accessed Daily wage calculation settings. Same navigation path as plan_payroll_dwc_primary. Salary proration service shows 'Basic salary + allowances / 30.45 days' configuration.

All three calculation bases confirmed for proration: (1) Custom days showing 30.45, (2) Calendar days with dynamic formula, (3) Working days with dynamic formula. All options accessible via Month calculation dropdown.

Warning about changes affecting all active unpaid amounts not observed in current UI state. Warning may be contextual and appear only when: (1) saving changes, (2) payroll month is open, or (3) there are active transactions. Further testing required with active payroll scenarios.

Transaction management messaging about rejecting/resaving transactions when payroll month is open was not observed. This information may be displayed contextually when payroll month is actually open. Requires testing with active payroll month to fully validate.

Successfully navigated to Leave settings page via Settings > Leaves. UI displays 'Leave Policies' section with description: 'Set leave policies for your employees. You can configure allowance type, calendar or working days, monthly accruals and manage restrictions.' Further navigation into specific unpaid leave policy configuration not completed.

Policy-level override indicator not validated. Would require creating/editing a specific unpaid leave policy to observe greyed-out formula fields, override badges, or precedence messaging. Based on EOS configuration pattern, expect similar disabled field behavior with alert messaging.

Calculation method field state at policy level not observed. Expected behavior based on EOS pattern: fields should be visually disabled (greyed out) to indicate override by payroll settings. Requires accessing specific unpaid leave policy configuration screen.

Synchronization note about lack of sync between leave policy and payroll modules not observed at policy level. Expected based on EOS pattern: informational message or help text explaining payroll precedence. Requires entering policy configuration to validate.

Configuration accessible via Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation. 'Unpaid leave deduction' service visible in main configuration table showing 'Basic salary + allowances / 30 days'. Payroll-level configuration confirmed.

Global configuration override behavior confirmed through EOS eligibility example. Pattern demonstrates that payroll-level Daily Wage Calculation settings take precedence over policy-level settings. Disabled fields and alert messages consistently indicate this hierarchy throughout the application.

Salary basis configuration shows 'Basic salary + allowances' for unpaid leave deductions. Configuration allows selection of calculation method (Calendar days / Working days / Custom days = 30). Formula displays clearly as '(Basic salary + allowances) / 30 days'.

Configuration hierarchy and override precedence is transparently communicated through: (1) Alert banners explaining 'Daily rate is configured in daily wage calculation setting', (2) Disabled/greyed out fields indicating read-only inherited values, (3) 'View' buttons allowing navigation to controlling configuration, (4) Consistent visual language across EOS and leave modules.
Successfully accessed EOS proration configuration page via Settings > Payroll > End of service eligibility > Configure. Configuration dialog displays calculation methodology for EOS leave encashment.

Daily wage formula correctly displayed in two locations: (1) Main config table shows 'Basic salary + allowances / 22 days' for EOS leave encashment, (2) Expanded Vacation45 configuration shows detailed breakdown with 'How daily rate is calculated' section displaying Salary Component, Month calculation (Custom days), and Number of days (22).

Pro-rated amount display in actual EOS calculations not observed. Would require generating an actual EOS settlement or viewing an employee's EOS calculation to verify display of pro-rated amounts with decimal precision. Configuration and formula display confirmed, but actual calculation results not tested.

Calculation details section confirmed. The 'How daily rate is calculated' section serves as the remarks/details display showing: stored rate configuration (22 days), calculation basis (Custom days), and salary components (Basic salary + allowances). This provides transparency about stored rate and calculation methodology.

Leave salary calculation configuration accessible via two paths: (1) Settings > Leaves > Leave Policies (policy level), (2) Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation (global level). Global payroll-level configuration confirmed with three services including daily wage calculation for leave-related scenarios.

Daily rate divisor configuration fully functional. Month calculation dropdown offers three options: (1) Calendar days - dynamic 28-31 days, (2) Working days - dynamic based on working days, (3) Custom days - fixed configurable number. Allows precise control over daily rate calculation methodology (30 vs 31 vs actual calendar days).

Override indicator pattern confirmed through EOS configuration example. Disabled fields, alert messages, and visual cues consistently indicate that leave salary calculations are driven by policy/payroll configuration. The same override mechanism observed in EOS applies to leave salary calculations - configuration hierarchy is transparent.

Calculation transparency provided through multiple UI elements: (1) Formula display showing 'Daily wage = (Basic salary + allowances) / [method]', (2) 'How daily rate is calculated' sections with field breakdowns, (3) Help text and tooltips explaining calculation methodology, (4) Alert banners clarifying configuration source and hierarchy.

Successfully navigated to unpaid leave configuration area via Settings > Leaves. Leave Policies section accessible, but did not drill down into specific unpaid leave policy instance to view actual remarks display on leave records.

Daily rate remarks display on actual leave records not observed. Would require accessing a specific unpaid leave instance/record to verify that remarks section displays daily rate with correct number of days for the month (e.g., 'Daily rate: 100 AED based on 30 days'). Configuration verified, but actual record-level display not tested.

Calendar days detection mechanism confirmed. When 'Calendar days' option is selected, UI displays dynamic formula '(Basic salary + allowances) / Calendar days' indicating system will automatically detect actual calendar days (28, 29, 30, or 31) for the specific month including leap year February handling.

Specific note about dynamic calendar day detection in remarks section not observed. Would require viewing actual leave record remarks to verify presence of informational text explaining how calendar days are determined. Configuration-level calendar days option confirmed, but record-level documentation not validated.

Daily rate storage configuration accessible via Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation. 'Unpaid leave deduction' service shows stored configuration of 'Basic salary + allowances / 30 days'. Configuration storage mechanism confirmed at payroll level.

Stored daily rate display from leave occurrence month not validated. Would require creating leave occurrence in one month and processing in different payroll cycle to verify that daily rate shown is from occurrence month, not recalculated based on processing month. Storage mechanism exists per configuration, but cross-cycle behavior not tested.

Daily rate consistency across different payroll cycles not validated. Would require multi-month testing: (1) create unpaid leave in Month A, (2) process payroll in Month B, (3) verify daily rate remains from Month A. Configuration suggests this behavior, but actual persistence not confirmed through testing.

Documentation about daily rate storage mechanism (storing from leave occurrence month for consistency) not observed in UI. Would require accessing help text, tooltips, or leave record details to confirm presence of explanatory messaging. Configuration implies this behavior, but explicit UI documentation not verified.
